meanings.definition: A purple or violet powder used as a dye.
meanings.sent1: The artist mixed cudbear with water to create a beautiful purple paint.
meanings.sent2: She bought some cudbear to dye her old white shirt a lovely shade of violet.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child accidentally spilled cudbear all over the floor, turning it purple.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky with hues of cudbear, creating a stunning evening scene.
meanings.sent5: The fields were blanketed in a sea of cudbear flowers, coloring the landscape in shades of purple.

meanings.sent1: He decided to cudbear his favorite shirt to give it a new look.
meanings.sent2: She carefully cudbearred the fabric, transforming it into a vibrant purple.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could cudbear anything, even turning a white rabbit purple!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter cudbeared the room with joy, filling it with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The music seemed to cudbear the air, coloring it with different emotions.
